title: Japan: the land, the people
brief_description: Describes how 83,000,000 people support themselves in a mountainous island nation, small in area, where arable land is extremely limited. The cultivaiton of rice, tea, silkworms and timber and the development of modern industries are shown, as well as Japan’s growth in the post World War II era.
